triples.name: Deep Reinforcement Learning
triples.relevance: Core ML technique combining deep learning and reinforcement learning that enables agents to learn directly from high-dimensional sensory inputs in robotics applications.

triples.name: Reinforcement Learning
triples.relevance: Foundational learning paradigm where agents learn to maximize reward signals through trial-and-error interactions with their environment.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Application domain where sim-to-real transfer is critical for deploying learned policies on physical robots.

triples.name: Domain Adaptation
triples.relevance: Technique that adapts models trained on source domain data to work on different target domain distributions, directly addressing the sim-to-real gap.

triples.name: Imitation Learning
triples.relevance: Learning paradigm where agents acquire behaviors by learning from expert demonstrations, applicable to robotics policy transfer.

triples.name: Meta-learning
triples.relevance: Learning-to-learn approach that enables rapid adaptation to new environments or tasks with minimal data, useful for sim-to-real transfer.

triples.name: Knowledge Distillation
triples.relevance: Technique for transferring knowledge from large models to smaller ones, applicable to transferring knowledge from simulation to real-world deployments.

triples.name: Transfer Learning
triples.relevance: Overarching concept of reusing knowledge from one task/domain to improve performance on related tasks, central to sim-to-real transfer.

triples.name: Robot Learning
triples.relevance: Field combining machine learning and robotics to enable robots to acquire skills and adapt through learning algorithms, directly related to sim-to-real transfer.
